AYAN-YUE GUPTA

Home Research Art C.V.

I am a PhD sociology student at the University of Bristol. My research interests cover computational social science, governmentality, natural language processing, pragmatics, philosophy of language, sociolinguistics and discourse analysis. My thesis is an investigation into using large language models to track the spread of governmental discourses surrounding 'resilience', 'sustainability' and 'wellbeing' across organisations of the British state during 2000-2020. More details and other work can be found here.

Before starting my PhD I was a practising artist in London. To see my art works visit my instagram and youtube pages.

E-mail: dm18378@bristol.ac.uk
